subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing Exception classes
msgSnippet: ... It might well be worthwhile, but I ve never done it myself. Another thing that s worth testing is that the right information propagates into the detail
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Have you found it worthwhile to try to find a universal contract test
> that checks some high percentage of a typical customized exception
> class's behavior? That might be nice. Something like GSBase's
> EqualsTester, but for exceptions.--

It might well be worthwhile, but I've never done it myself.

Another thing that's worth testing is that the right information
propagates into the detail message. For instance, if my code throws a
syntax exception on line 32, then I might write code to test that the
string "32" is found in the exception message. Sometimes it's just
passed in from outside the exception class, but sometimes it's not.
